projects_subtitle: Unified view of configured projects, the active one, and quick actions.
project_api_subtitle: Configure API connector for the active project
project_api_hint: Configure the connector for this project only.
project_note_scan: Each project keeps its own cache, snapshots, and Meeting license.
project_note_security: Deleting removes only the config entry, never your files.
project_note_refresh: Hit Refresh after manually editing the .jupiter.yaml file.
project_list_subtitle: Activate, refresh, or delete an entry.
project_ignore_hint: Checked items will be ignored during scans.
project_ignore_empty: No files or folders detected at the root.
delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete the project "{name}"? (Files will not be deleted)
watch_started: Watch mode started. Run commands with dynamic analysis to track function calls.
watch_subtitle: Track scans, analyses and events in real-time.
watch_tip: Launch a Scan or use Run with dynamic analysis to see events in real-time.
api_docs_intro: Jupiter automatically analyzes API endpoints in your project (FastAPI, Flask, Django, etc.).
api_docs_config: To configure detection, ensure your <project>.jupiter.yaml file contains the correct api section.
d_upload_subtitle: Drop a .json file generated by jupiter scan or use the sample.
d_upload_prompt: Drag a report or click to browse.
d_upload_compat: Compatible with static scans and future incremental analyses.
s_meeting_desc: The actual status will be synchronized via the Meeting adapter.
s_theme_desc: Switch between light and dark theme.
settings_log_level_hint: Controls Jupiter verbosity (Debug, Info, Warning, Error, Critical).
settings_log_path_hint: Destination file for logs (leave empty to disable file output).
settings_log_reset_hint: If checked, log file is cleared on each startup. Otherwise, a separator with timestamp is added.
no_data_to_export: No data to export. Please run a scan first.
run_cwd_hint: Leave empty to use project root
error_fetch: Could not connect to Jupiter API server. Make sure it is running on http://localhost:8000.
analysis_empty: Load a report to populate the indicators.
hotspots_empty: No hotspots available without a report.
alert_no_report_detail: Import a JSON produced by `jupiter scan` to fill the cards and tables.
alert_unused_detail: A static analysis found functions that may not be called.
alert_meeting_not_configured: Meeting integration not configured. Set a device key in Settings.
alert_meeting_licensed: Device licensed and registered with Meeting.
alert_meeting_expired: Trial expired. Please configure a valid license key.
alert_plugin_pending_detail: The following plugins are pending configuration: {plugins}
alert_plugin_disabled_detail: Disabled plugins: {plugins}. Enable them in Settings.
a_overview_subtitle: Top extensions, average sizes, and freshest files.
alerts_subtitle: Plugin states, Meeting license, and inactive functions.
hotspots_subtitle: Ranking of files with the most functions.
q_complexity_subtitle: Naive estimation based on control structures.
diag_subtitle: API endpoint status and served root.
live_events_subtitle: Latest UI actions and future WS notifications.
files_help_intro: This view displays all files analyzed by Jupiter during the last scan.
files_help_actions_simulate: üî¨ Simulate: Analyze the impact of removing this file
files_help_simulator_desc: The simulator shows which other files and functions would be affected if this file were removed. Useful for refactoring safely.
files_help_tips_search: Use the search to quickly find a file
files_help_tips_filter: Filter by file type to focus on specific languages
files_help_tips_sort: Click column headers to sort (coming soon)
functions_help_intro: This view lists all functions detected in your project with usage analysis.
functions_help_columns_lines: Lines: Number of lines of code
functions_help_columns_calls: Calls: Dynamic call count (from Watch mode)
functions_help_columns_status: Status: Used, Unused, or Called dynamically
functions_help_actions_simulate: üî¨ Simulate: Analyze impact of removing this function
functions_help_actions_goto: üìÑ Go to file: Open the source file
functions_help_graph_desc: The graph below the table shows function call relationships detected during Watch mode execution.
functions_help_tips_unused: Unused functions may be dead code ‚Äì consider removing them
functions_help_tips_watch: Use Watch mode to track real function calls
functions_help_tips_simulate: Simulate removal before deleting to check dependencies
functions_export_instructions: Copy this formatted report and paste it into your AI coding assistant (ChatGPT, Claude, Copilot, etc.). The AI agent will analyze each function to determine if it's truly orphan.
functions_export_copied: Unused functions report copied to clipboard
livemap_no_data: No graph data available. Run a scan first.
livemap_help_intro: The Live Map displays your project's file dependencies as an interactive graph.
livemap_help_what_desc: Live Map visualizes the dependency graph of your project. Each node represents a file or module, and edges show import relationships between them.
livemap_help_interact_hover: Hover a node to see its name
livemap_help_simplify_desc: Groups files by folder to reduce clutter on large projects.
livemap_help_tip_scan: Run a scan first to populate the graph
livemap_help_tip_large: For projects with 1000+ files, Simplify mode is auto-enabled
livemap_help_tip_settings: Configure defaults in Settings > Plugins > Live Map
livemap_help_zoom: Use your scroll wheel to zoom in/out.
livemap_help_pan: Click and drag the background to pan.
livemap_help_hover: Hover over a node to see its full path.
livemap_help_simplify: Use 'Simplify' to group files by folder for large projects.
watchdog_description: Automatically reload plugins when their source files are modified. Useful during plugin development to avoid restarting Jupiter.
watchdog_enabled_hint: Start monitoring plugin files for changes.
watchdog_auto_reload_hint: Automatically reload plugins when changes are detected.
watchdog_interval_hint: How often to check for file changes.
bridge_description: Core services gateway providing stable API access for plugins. The Bridge decouples plugins from Jupiter internals.
bridge_help_intro: The Bridge provides a stable, versioned API layer between plugins and Jupiter's core functionality.
bridge_help_point_1: Plugins use the Bridge to access services like scanning, caching, and event emission.
bridge_help_point_2: Services are lazy-loaded: only instantiated when first accessed.
bridge_help_point_3: The API is versioned, allowing Jupiter internals to evolve without breaking plugins.
plugins_subtitle: Enable, configure, and monitor Jupiter extensions.
plugins_help_intro: Plugins extend Jupiter with extra features (code quality, notifications, API integrations, etc.).
plugins_help_point_1: Each plugin can be enabled or disabled independently.
plugins_help_point_2: Some plugins add views in the left sidebar (e.g. code quality dashboards).
plugins_help_point_3: Others add sections in Settings > Plugins for advanced options.
plugins_help_note: Tip: if something seems missing in the UI, check here if the corresponding plugin is enabled.
plugins_how_to_step_1: Open this page to see all available plugins.
plugins_how_to_step_2: Enable the plugins you care about (for example: Notifications).
plugins_how_to_step_3: Go to the Settings tab to fine-tune their configuration if needed.
plugins_install_intro: Install a plugin from a URL or a local file.
plugins_install_url_hint: Direct URL to a ZIP file or Git repository.
plugins_install_permissions_hint: These permissions will be granted to the plugin upon installation.
plugins_uninstall_intro: Select the plugin to remove from your Jupiter installation.
plugins_uninstall_confirm_msg: This action will permanently delete the plugin and its files. This operation is irreversible.
circuit_breaker_open_tooltip: Circuit breaker open - too many failures. Jobs temporarily blocked.
plugin_activity_requests_tooltip: Total API requests handled by this plugin
plugin_activity_error_rate_tooltip: Percentage of requests that resulted in errors
plugin_activity_last_tooltip: When this plugin was last active
hot_reload_confirm: Hot reload this plugin? This will reload the plugin without restarting the server.
hot_reload_dev_mode_required: Hot reload requires developer mode to be enabled
dry_run_success: Dry run successful - settings are valid
dry_run_failed: Dry run failed - check validation errors
dry_run_not_supported: Dry run not supported by this plugin
history_subtitle: Each scan persists a diffable snapshot.
history_diff_subtitle: Select two snapshots to analyze changes.
history_slot_empty: Select a snapshot to preview its stats.
history_diff_placeholder: Pick two snapshots then launch the diff.
history_diff_missing: Please pick two snapshots before diffing.
update_source_help: Provide a path to a ZIP file or a Git URL (e.g., git+https://github.com/...).
suggestions_no_report: No report available. Please run a scan first.
meeting_device_key_hint: Unique identification key for the Meeting service.
meeting_auth_token_hint: Authentication token if required by the Meeting API.
meeting_heartbeat_hint: Interval between heartbeat signals sent to Meeting. Default: 60 seconds.
onboarding_message: No project is configured in this folder.
onboarding_redirect_projects: Redirecting to Projects page to configure the project.
api_no_endpoints: No endpoints detected in this API
api_not_configured: API not configured for this project
pylance_subtitle: Static type checking powered by Pyright, the engine behind VS Code's Pylance extension.
pylance_no_data_hint: Run a scan from the top bar to analyze your Python files.
pylance_no_python: This project does not contain Python files.
pylance_no_python_hint: Add .py files or switch to a Python project, then rerun a scan to see diagnostics.
pylance_all_good_hint: Your Python code passes static type checking.
pylance_help_intro: This page displays static type analysis results from Pyright, the same engine that powers the Pylance extension in VS Code.
pylance_help_what_1: üî¥ Type errors: incompatible types, missing attributes, wrong arguments
pylance_help_what_2: üü° Warnings: unused imports, unreachable code, deprecated usage
pylance_help_what_3: üîµ Info: suggestions for better type annotations
pylance_help_how_1: Run a Scan from the top bar ‚Äì Pyright analysis runs automatically
pylance_help_how_2: Review the summary stats and file list below
pylance_help_how_3: Click View on any file to see detailed diagnostics
pylance_help_how_4: Use Export to copy results for AI coding assistants
pylance_help_export_desc: The Export button copies a formatted summary to your clipboard, ready to paste into ChatGPT, Claude, Copilot, or any AI coding assistant.
pylance_help_requirements_desc: Pyright must be installed: pip install pyright
pylance_export_instructions: Copy this formatted report and paste it into your AI coding assistant (ChatGPT, Claude, Copilot, etc.)
code_quality_subtitle: Comprehensive analysis of complexity, duplication, and maintainability.
code_quality_settings_hint: Fine-tune how deep the analyzer runs and when it raises warnings.
cq_max_files_hint: Keep the run snappy on large repos by limiting parsed files.
cq_complexity_threshold_hint: Files crossing this threshold are flagged orange/red in the UI.
cq_dup_chunk_hint: Lines per block when searching for clones. Smaller chunks are more sensitive.
cq_include_tests_hint: Toggle to include `tests/` and `__tests__` folders in the metrics.
notifications_url_help: Leave empty to use local notifications only (displayed in the UI).
ci_subtitle: Run automated quality checks against configurable thresholds.
settings_allow_run_hint: Allow shell command execution via the interface.
ci_config_subtitle: Override thresholds for this check (leave empty for config defaults).
ci_config_note: Defaults are read from your project's ci.fail_on config section.
ci_history_subtitle: Track your quality gate results over time.
autodiag_subtitle: Detect false positives in unused function detection through dynamic validation.
autodiag_help_intro: Autodiag validates Jupiter's static analysis by running dynamic tests. It compares functions flagged as "unused" with actual runtime usage to detect false positives.
autodiag_help_step_1: üìä Static Analysis: Identifies potentially unused functions
autodiag_help_step_2: üß™ Dynamic Validation: Executes CLI commands, API calls, and plugin hooks
autodiag_help_step_3: üîç Comparison: Compares predictions with actual runtime calls
autodiag_help_step_4: üìã Report: Lists false positives and truly unused functions
autodiag_help_confidence_desc: Each function gets a confidence score (0-100%) indicating how likely it is to be truly unused. Lower scores mean higher chance of being a false positive.
autodiag_idle: No autodiag analysis has been run yet.
autodiag_idle_hint: Click "Run Autodiag" to start the analysis.
autodiag_running_hint: This may take a few seconds. Testing CLI, API, and plugin scenarios.
autodiag_server_hint: The autodiag server runs on port 8081 (localhost only). Make sure the server is started with autodiag enabled in your config.
autodiag_scenarios_subtitle: Results of CLI, API, and plugin hook tests.
autodiag_fp_subtitle: Functions flagged as unused but actually called during tests.
autodiag_unused_subtitle: Functions that were not called during any test scenario.
autodiag_conf_subtitle: Detailed confidence analysis for all functions.
autodiag_confidence_error: Failed to load confidence data. Is the diag server running?
autodiag_settings_description: Configure the automatic diagnostic tool for false-positive detection.
autodiag_setting_enabled_hint: When disabled, the autodiag view will be hidden from the sidebar.
autodiag_setting_auto_run_hint: ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: This can slow down scans significantly.
autodiag_setting_confidence_hint: Display confidence percentages in the function analysis table.
autodiag_setting_port_hint: Port number for the local autodiag server (default: 8081).
autodiag_setting_timeout_hint: Maximum execution time for each scenario.
autodiag_no_data: No data available. Run a scan first then load the data.
autodiag_export_instructions: Copy this formatted report to share with an AI agent for further analysis and recommendations:
